author: L Renganathan
text:
Vijayabhaskar asks officials to monitor chlorine levels in drinking water

Ensure that only protected and treated water is supplied to pilgrims during the Mahamaham slated for February 22. Also, take steps to prevent outbreak of communicable diseases in the region during the period, Health Minister C. Vijayabhaskar told officials of the Department of Health and Family Welfare at a preparedness review meet held here on Monday.

Dr. Vijayabhaskar said that the chlorine levels in the treated potable water to be supplied to the pilgrims must be monitored continuously, ensure that only quality products, in particular the edible items, were sold in the market during the festival period. The Minister called upon the Kumbakonam Municipality officials to undertake sustained and severe anti-mosquito drives in the run up to the festival.

He said that 137 special medical centres would be established to meet the demands from the estimated 45 lakh pilgrims expected to visit the temple town during the period.

Dr. Vijayabhaskar directed the department officials to request proper allotment of medical, paramedical and support service personnel, to ensure that the festival was conducted safely.

Thanjavur MLA M. Rengasamy, Kumbakonam Municipal Chairperson Rathna Sekar, former MLA Rama Ramanathan, Director of Public Health and Disease Prevention K. Kulandaisamy, Director of Health and Rural Services (in charge) S. Mani, Additional Director Vadivelan, Joint Director Chandrasekaran, Dean of Thanjavur Medical College K. Pitchai Balashanmugham, Dean of Tiruvarur Medical College AL. Meenakshisundaram, and Dean of KAP Viswanatham Government Medical College, Tiruchi, MK. Muralidharan, participated.
title: Minister reviews Mahamaham preparations
